questions.question: What is the Hijrah?
questions.explanation: The Hijrah was Prophet Muhammad's migration from Mecca to Medina in 622 CE.

questions.question: Which city is known as the birthplace of Prophet Muhammad?
questions.explanation: Prophet Muhammad was born in Mecca, Saudi Arabia.

questions.question: What is Eid al-Fitr?
questions.explanation: Eid al-Fitr is the festival celebrating the end of Ramadan.

questions.question: What is Eid al-Adha?
questions.explanation: Eid al-Adha is the Festival of Sacrifice, commemorating Prophet Ibrahim's willingness to sacrifice his son.

questions.question: What is Laylat al-Qadr?
questions.explanation: Laylat al-Qadr (Night of Power) is the night when the Quran was first revealed.

questions.question: What is the holiest city in Islam?
questions.explanation: Mecca is the holiest city in Islam, home to the Kaaba.

questions.question: What year did Prophet Muhammad migrate to Medina?
questions.explanation: The Hijrah to Medina happened in 622 CE, which marks the start of the Islamic calendar.

questions.question: What is the name of the cube-shaped building in Mecca?
questions.explanation: The Kaaba is the cube-shaped building that Muslims face during prayer.

questions.question: Who was the first Muezzin (caller to prayer)?
questions.explanation: Bilal ibn Rabah was the first Muezzin in Islam, chosen by Prophet Muhammad.

questions.question: What is the first month of the Islamic calendar?
questions.explanation: Muharram is the first month of the Islamic (Hijri) calendar.
